title: Asia stocks take heart as Beijing limits yuan slide
text: Asian shares were trying to rally on Thursday after Beijing limited the fall in its yuan and provided temporary relief from fears of a global currency war, though worries about recession still lurked in the background.

title: China is set to release trade data for July. Here's what to expect
text: Economists polled by Reuters expect July's exports to fall by 2% from a year ago, and imports to decline by 8.3% over the same period.

title: Weaker dollar supports oil prices after slump
text: Oil futures jumped more than $1 a barrel on Thursday amid a weaker dollar, recovering ground after concerns that a global economic slowdown would hurt crude demand sparked losses of over 4% in the previous session.

title: IRS means business when it comes to bitcoin
text: In my last column, I reported that the IRS is going after people who trade bitcoin and other virtual currencies — and didn’t bother to pay tax on their gains. In fact, I’m told the IRS sent out 10,000 letters to people who could be tax scofflaws because of virtual currency transactions and not reporting.

title: Asia stocks paralyzed, bonds electrified by recession risk
text: Asian shares braced for more volatility on Thursday as eye-catching easings by central banks stoked fears of global recession, driving U.S. yields to near-record lows and lifting gold past $1,500 for the first time since 2013.

title: Dollar will be cut down to size if Fed gives in to market whims - Reuters poll
text: The U.S. dollar's dominance will come to an end if the Federal Reserve gives in to pressure from financial markets and President Donald Trump and chops interest rates another 50 basis points this year, a Reuters poll of market strategists showed.

title: Stock Market Sell-Off Intensifies: Where Do We Go From Here?
text: As the stock market sell-off intensifies, where do we go from here? Randy Watts, Chief Investment Strategist of William O'Neil + Co. discusses his take on the current market environment and what factors could improve the investing landscape.

title: Cramer: Action in the bond market does not mean a recession is around the corner
text: U.S. Treasurys are giving you a much better return than bonds from any other developed country right now.

title: Cramer: We need to 'stop obsessing about the seemingly terrifying decline in treasury yields'
text: Jim Cramer speaks after the Dow recovered the bulk of a nearly 600-point drop on Wednesday as a sharp decline in bond yields stabilized.

title: Fundstrat's Lee Feels Confident About U.S. Stocks, Expects Second-Half Rally
text: Tom Lee, Fundstrat Global Advisors managing partner and head of research, discusses the outlook for U.S. stocks with Bloomberg's Joe Weisenthal and Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Markets: What'd You Miss?"

title: Here's why IPO lockups threaten the market in the second half of 2019
text: CNBC's Leslie Picker joins "Closing Bell" to discuss why IPO lockups are a key technical risk that pose a threat to the second half of the year.

title: This chart shows markets could return to their December lows
text: Mark Newton Mark Newton Advisors, on key levels to watch. With CNBC's Steve Liesman and Melissa Lee, and the Fast Money traders, Pete Najarian, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Guy Adami.

title: US-China trade war is hurting farmers, but they're sticking with Trump
text: Recent polls show farmers strongly support Trump, even amid rising tariffs with china. Experts say they're likely to stay on his side in 2020.

title: High volatility keeps stocks on edge—5 strategists on what's next for the market
text: With concerns a global economic slowdown is approaching and no trade deal in sight, experts worry there will be more pain in the market.

title: Another wild day on Wall Street ends with a massive comeback
text: The market was down nearly 600 points at its low before a huge comeback.

title: Foreign central banks are cutting rates, amping up pressure on Fed
text: Yields drop on global easing.

title: How to navigate a volatile market: Investment advisor
text: Whitford Asset Management's Dominic Catrambone weighs in with tips on how to survive a volatile market.

title: S&P 500 erases big losses to end up; investors buy bargains, yields off lows
text: The S&P 500 recovered from steep early losses to end slightly higher on Wednesday as investors snapped up oversold shares and bond yields rebounded from significant lows that raised fears about a recession.

title: Stocks to Trade Sideways for Next Few Weeks, Prosper Trading Academy CEO Says
text: On this edition of "Options Insight," Prosper Trading Academy Chief Executive Officer Scott Bauer examines the recent stock market volatility and what it means for the future of equities with Bloomberg's Abigail Doolittle on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

text: Herb Morgan, chief investment officer of Efficient Market Advisors, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the day's market action.

text: Mark Cabana, head of U.S. rates strategy at Bank of America, joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss the volatile market action and how the Fed may respond to increased global tensions.

title: Huawei should never have been part of the trade deal: Dan David
text: Wolfpack Research founder Dan David discusses how the Trump administration may ban federal agencies from conducting business with Chinese tech giant Huawei.

title: Tumbling bond yields ramp up the pressure for the Fed to cut rates
text: The Federal Reserve's "midcycle adjustment" to interest rates could be morphing into something considerably more serious.

title: Chinese billionaire Weijian Shan on the escalating trade tensions
text: Weijian Shan, PAG chairman and CEO, discusses the trade tensions between the U.S. and China and the devaluation of the yuan with CNBC's "Squawk Alley".

title: Crude oil sinks to seven month low amid trade fears
text: Delta Derivatives Lead Option Strategist discusses oil prices and gold with Yahoo Finance's Aikiko Fujita.

title: S&P 500 bounces back from early lows; Nasdaq higher
text: The S&P 500 recovered from steep early losses to trade modestly higher by late afternoon on Wednesday as investors snapped up oversold shares, although signals from the bond market of a higher risk of recession kept a lid on gains.

title: Rush into U.S. bonds curbs global stock markets; gold touches six-year high
text: Investors rushed into the safety of U.S. government bonds on Wednesday, muting a broad stocks rally as fears of a global recession grew.

title: Ray Dalio calls for investing in China amid trade tensions
text: Bridgewater Associates Founder Ray Dalio discusses investing in China because of growth, market capitalization and the bond markets.

title: Lows odds of a trade deal between US, China within a year: Expert
text: Christopher Smart of Barings discusses his view on the market sell-off amid rising trade tensions between the U.S.

title: Oil dives nearly 5% to seven-month low on surprise U.S. stock build, trade war
text: Oil prices tumbled more than 4.5% on Wednesday to a seven-month low, extending recent heavy losses following a surprise build in U.S. crude stockpiles and fears that demand will shrink due to Washington's escalating trade war with Beijing.

title: Santelli Exchange: A race to the bottom
text: CNBC's Rick Santelli reports on slowing global growth and monetary policy.

text: Bill Strazzullo of Bell Curve Trading breaks down the market technicals investors should know with CNBC's "Power Lunch" team.

title: Why Oil Is Falling Despite Geopolitical Tensions
text: Despite heightened global tensions surrounding the Middle Eastern oil giant Iran, the commodity was trading lower by more than 3%.

title: Dow Stocks Turn Negative on Wednesday
text: Dow stocks were in the red on Wednesday. After the U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates, other countries followed suit.

title: Don't make portfolio changes based on uncertainty: Wealth advisor
text: Dan Nathan, a "Fast Money" trader, Sherry Paul of UBS and Jason Pride of Glenmede join CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to discuss how markets are trading and what they think investors should watch for during market volatility.

title: China trade tension causes dip in foreign travel to US
text: FBN's Grady Trimble on the decline in foreign travel to the U.S.

text: Komal Sri-Kumar, Sri-Kumar global strategies, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss the global bond yield sliding and why he thinks the 10-year yield will continue downwards.

title: Here's the level where Guggenheim's Minerd sees the 10-year yield ending its decline for now
text: Guggenheim's Scott Minerd said the sharp decline in the benchmark 10-year yield could reach 1.4% before correcting.

title: Why this pro says he doesn't see signs of a US recession
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team breaks down what the bond markets may signal with Mike Feroli of J.P.Morgan; Peter Boockvar, CIO of Bleakley Advisory Group; CNBC's Steve Liesman and Rick Santelli.

title: The direction of the US stock market is being determined by China's currency right now
text: Wall Street is obsessed with the yuan right now.

title: Trump administration bans federal agencies from buying Huawei, ZTE tech
text: The Trump administration has banned U.S. federal agencies from buying equipment and obtaining services from Huawei and two other companies as part of the government’s latest crackdown on Chinese technology amid national security fears.

title: We're going to end up in recession: Guggenheim Partner's Scott Minerd
text: Guggenheim Partners Global CIO Scott Minerd joins 'The Exchange' to discuss the state of the markets and interest rates.

title: Trump has 'huge appetite' for trade deal with UK - Raab
text: President Trump has a "huge appetite" to sign a free trade deal with the UK, Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab has said.

title: China's cheating has to stop, says Trump's China advisor
text: Michael Pillsbury, Trump China advisor, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss the U.S..-China trade war and the President's China strategy.

title: Steepest drop in 10-year yield since S&P downgrade of US
text: The 10-year Treasury yield is having its steepest drop since late-July to early-August 2011 — the days surrounding S&P's downgrade of the U.S. credit rating.
